title: Europe Agrees to $105 Billion Funding Plan for Ukraine
summary: European Union officials wanted to use Russia’s frozen assets to back a major loan to Ukraine. Unable to overcome opposition, they settled on another way to lend the money.

title: Putin’s Year-End News Conference Set for Friday
summary: The annual news conference sets the Kremlin’s tone for the next year and highlights President Vladimir V. Putin’s grip over Russia.

title: Judge Convicted of Obstructing Agents as They Sought Undocumented Immigrant
summary: The Wisconsin state judge, Hannah C. Dugan, was accused of ushering a man to a side door as federal agents waited outside a courtroom.

title: Takeaways From the Trial of Wisconsin Judge Hannah Dugan
summary: The Milwaukee judge was charged with obstructing federal immigration agents, who were trying to arrest a man who had appeared before her on a battery charge.

title: Kennedy Center Board Moves to Rename It the Trump-Kennedy Center
summary: The board for the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts announced that it would now be named the Trump-Kennedy Center, although a formal change may have to be approved by Congress.

title: Trump Administration to Appeal Harvard Funding Case
summary: Facing a deadline to appeal, the Justice Department told the courts late Thursday that it would try to overturn a judge’s ruling in favor of Harvard.

title: Trump Signs Order to Ease Restrictions on Marijuana
summary: Marijuana’s classification as one of the most dangerous and habit-forming substances has long drawn criticism.

title: Trump Announces $1,776 ‘Warrior Dividend’ for Military
summary: President Trump promised active duty troops a $1,776 check, citing increased revenue raised by tariffs, but the funding is coming from money for the military included in this year’s domestic spending law.

title: ‘A Singularly Turbulent Time’: Deeper Uncertainty in Store for Global Economy
summary: A reordering of the rules of trade, set on top of transformational change in technology, demographics and climate, is remaking jobs, politics and lives.

title: Bank of Japan Raises Interest Rates to Highest Level in 30 Years
summary: The Bank of Japan moved to slow inflation as the prime minister is borrowing more to fund an ambitious effort to build up industry and support households.

title: ‘Don’s Best Friend’: How Epstein and Trump Bonded Over the Pursuit of Women
summary: The president has tried to minimize their friendship, but documents and interviews reveal an intense and complicated relationship. Chasing women was a game of ego and dominance. Female bodies were currency.

title: Britain Is Preparing for Attacks on Its Soil. Critics Say It Must Move Faster.
summary: As military officials sound the alarm over Russian hybrid attacks, the chair of Parliament’s defense committee said the government’s progress on ramping up home defense was “glacial.”

title: Rob Reiner Family Tragedy Strikes a Nerve for Families Fighting Addiction
summary: Nick Reiner, charged with murdering his parents, Rob and Michele Singer Reiner, spent much of his life battling drug addiction, an affliction that millions of Americans face.

title: After Rob Reiner’s ‘North’ Flopped, He Proved He Could Take Criticism With Humor
summary: Roger Ebert said he “hated, hated, hated, hated, hated” Reiner’s 1994 film “North.” The director took it in stride.

title: Mamdani Appointee Resigns After Decade-Old Antisemitic Posts Re-emerge
summary: Catherine Almonte Da Costa resigned from her just-announced post as Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani’s director of appointments after the Anti-Defamation League resurfaced the comments.

title: Trump Relies on Distortions to Support His Pressure Campaign on Venezuela
summary: The president has a long record of making false or misleading statements. But the sheer density of them in his administration’s boat attacks and Venezuela pressure campaign is exceptional.

title: How Did a City of 10 Million People Nearly Run Out of Water?
summary: Restricting Tehran’s growth and water use — however politically difficult — would be more prudent than trying to engineer ever more elaborate workarounds.

title: Justin Trudeau and Katy Perry Are Worth Rooting For
summary: As a politician, Justin Trudeau was an excellent celebrity. And the rest of the world could learn a useful lesson from how he wielded his star power.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene, Donald Trump Jr. and More Conservative Figures Announce Their Engagements
summary: Several prominent conservative figures have announced that they are engaged this week, news often celebrated by President Trump.

title: Several Billion Dollars Were Lost to Fraud in Minnesota, Prosecutors Say
summary: Federal prosecutors said they were now investigating fraud worth billions of dollars in 14 social services programs in the state.

title: Palo Alto Confronts Billionaires Over Their Housing Compounds
summary: The Silicon Valley college town has changed drastically as Mark Zuckerberg, Larry Page and other tech founders have scooped up multiple properties.

title: The D.N.C. Is Scrapping Its Report on What Went Wrong in 2024
summary: Ken Martin, the Democratic National Committee chairman, ordered the autopsy months ago but is now said to believe that its release would be counterproductive for the party.
